title.narrative: EDUCATION SECTOR S CAPACITY

description.narrative: Education sector's capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education and retention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Education sector's capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education and retention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education sector?s capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education andretention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the regulatory framework of inclusive education, and effective pre-primary schooldecentralization.;UNICEF effectively advocated for the reopening of schools and provided technical support to ensure effective implementation of the Ministry of Education&39;s Response Plan to COVID-19. In this context, UNICEF contributed to the designed a TV- and radio-lessons, including Sign language translation (SLT) that allowed continuity of the teaching-learning process during school closure period together with other inter-sectoral actions such as creation of psychosocial support, WASH infrastructures in schools and delivery of "Back to school" kits to 7,500 vulnerable children in pre-school, primary and secondary education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
